meanings.definition: Capable of being easily seen or understood.
meanings.sent1: The bright red car was obviable from far away.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were obviable and simple to follow.
meanings.sent3: It was obviable that the cat had stolen the cookie.
meanings.sent4: The truth was obviable, shining like a beacon in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The smile on her face was obviable, showing her happiness to all.

meanings.definition: Able to be observed or perceived.
meanings.sent1: The obviable stars twinkled in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The changes in the weather were obviable to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The obviable look on his face made me burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was obviable, touching everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was obviable, making everyone uneasy.

meanings.definition: Possible to be noticed or recognized.
meanings.sent1: The obviable mistake in the report was quickly corrected.
meanings.sent2: His talent was obviable to all who saw him perform.
meanings.sent3: The obviable scent of freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The obviable joy in her eyes was contagious to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The obviable sound of laughter echoed through the room.
